fol.186v
To my L. T
re
r July 24 1591.
fol.186r
Belgia. 1591 24 July To my L. Trea
s
Belgia: 1591: July.
May it please yo
r
good L. There were of o
r
souldiers
that came this morning to
e
Count
w
th
certayn l
re
s of
the Ennemy, w
ch
they had intercepted, among w
ch
there
were 2 of
Vasseur
a secretary of theyr state & of
great authority among them. I have sent yo
r
L. the
transscript of them both, supposing it nedefull, that
e
tenor of the one declaring
it nedefull
expressly, that there
is order out of
Spain
for
e
Duke
to go for
Fraunce,
&
likewise of
e other conteyning the specialities of
e
Ennemies forces expected out of
Germany,
should bee spedily
notefied to her
Ma
ty
.
For wee did never make acchount of
more then 1500 horse, & some few ensignes of foot that
they had levied in those quarters. Whether
e Veador
to whom our l
re
is addressed bee at
Brussels
or
Anwerp
wee kannot certainly learne, for it was omitted in
e
endorsment of
e letter. I signifyed in my last
e
23 of this moneth, that
e D. was m
r
ched from
Nieumeg
en
toward
e Maese, w
th
intention as now it is c
r
tifiyed
to pitch his cane at
Maestricht.
How bee yt we know
it not otherwise th
e
by these intercepted nor wee are not
yet assured, if hee leave any garrison in Nieumegen.
Being oth
r
wise desolate of a p
nt
messenger, I requested
M
r
Allen
the bearer hereof, to cary these l
re
s of
purpose, w
ch
I hope will stand w
th
yo
r
Ho. good liking
& I am certain hee will use all possible diligence
And so &c. Arnh
a
July 24 1591.
